pageContext.claim: “Everybody thought this summer [covid-19] would go away and it would come back in the fall. Well, when the summer came, they used to say the heat -- the heat was good for it and it really knocks it out, remember?”
pageContext.analysis: In the spring, administration public health officials disputed Trump’s prediction, which appeared to be rooted in the idea that flu season in the United States generally ends in the spring. The virus was already spreading in Singapore, where temperatures are akin to summer in the United States. Asked whether he agreed that the new coronavirus would be gone by April, Robert Redfield, the director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, told Congress he did not. “Prudent to assume this pathogen will be with us for some time to come,” he said.
